title: CureVac Covid-19 Vaccine 48% Effective in Pivotal Study
summary: Shares in the German drugmaker dropped nearly 9% after it released the disappointing results. German company CureVac NV released the final results for its once-promising Covid-19 vaccine, finding it provided less protection than the vaccines already authorized for use in the U.S.

title: Miami-Area Collapsed Condo Crews Keep Looking for Survivors on Day 7
summary: National Institute of Standards and Technology opens probe into causes of collapse; more bodies are found at site. title: Revised Ranked-Choice Tally Shows Tight Race in NYC Mayoral Contest
summary: After botching count on Tuesday, Board of Elections' new results give Eric Adams narrow lead over Kathryn Garcia. The New York City Board of Elections on Wednesday released a new preliminary tabulation of ranked-choice voting in the Democratic mayoral race after botching an earlier count.

title: New York City Lawmakers Approve $98.7 Billion Budget
summary: Funding for the coming fiscal year relies heavily on federal stimulus money. Mayor Bill de Blasio and the New York City Council agreed Wednesday on a $98.7 billion budget for the coming fiscal year that relies heavily on federal stimulus dollars to boost the city's recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic, including making investments in education and economic growth.

summary: IPO or SPAC deal could value TPG at about $10 billion. TPG, one of the last of the original private-equity giants to remain a closely held partnership, is evaluating a public listing, people familiar with the matter said.

summary: He will succeed Greg Smith, who is set to retire in July. The plane maker also named a former airline pilot to its board.. Boeing Co. named Brian West, a veteran of the aircraft-engine maker General Electric Co. , as its next chief financial officer.

title: Bill Cosby Released After Sexual Conviction Overturned
summary: Pennsylvania Supreme Court cites an earlier prosecutors' decision not to bring charges against the entertainer. The Pennsylvania Supreme Court ordered the release of entertainer Bill Cosby on Wednesday after overturning his conviction for sexual assault, one of the key prosecutions in the #MeToo movement that brought the issue of sexual assault against women onto the national stage.

title: Corruption, Cybercrime Top List of U.S. Anti-Money-Laundering Concerns

title: Internet's Original Source Code Sold as NFT for $5.4 Million

title: The NIH's Diversity Obsession Subverts Science
summary: A project to understand the brain becomes a futile effort to make up for educational disparities.. The National Institutes of Health supports a multidisciplinary neuroscience initiative to expand understanding of the brain. Research applications include treatments for Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, autism and depression. On June 10, NIH director Francis Collins announced a new requirement for participating in the brain initiative. Neurologists, molecular biologists and nanophysicists seeking NIH funding must now submit a plan showing how they will "enhance diverse perspectives" throughout their research. Scores on the "plan for enhancing diverse perspectives" will inform funding decisions.

title: Should You Really Use a Travel Agent?
summary: Traveling this year requires a lot more legwork. Here are four reasons to enlist a pro and two reasons why you're better off on your own.. HOW EXCITING it is, at last, to be planning a vacation. For many, it's the first one since the pandemic grounded planes, shuttered hotels and created legions of new windowsill farmers. But where to go that's welcoming Americans? And where to start sorting out what's required to get there? Anxiety can eclipse the giddiness when the realities of the world come into focus. "When travel gets more complicated," said Gary Leff, the blogger behind ViewFromtheWing, "people will look for guidance." Suddenly, interest in travel agents is higher than it was in 2019-which was a good year for the industry. Even seasoned independent travelers are turning to pros. Laurie Kantor Finn, a small-business owner in Los Angeles who is traveling to France with her husband, son and friends this summer, hadn't used a travel agent in 20 years. "We're control freaks," she said. "We like to plot, read articles and guides, use the internet to research and find great rates. We enjoy the process." This time, though, it's different. "Due to Covid, it'd be helpful to have someone on the ground." So she's hired an Italy-based adviser who specializes in France to smooth the way. In normal times, enlisting someone to design a hiccup-free trip might seem like a bourgeois indulgence; in these times, it feels more like common sense. Here, four reasons to use a travel agent now-and two reasons not to.

summary: Pharmacies scale back hours and space for shots as demand wanes, while mass-vaccination sites across U.S. close their doors. A CVS in suburban New York is selling summer toys and canned food in an aisle previously used for Covid-19 shots. Hundreds of Rite Aid Corp. stores will end extended Friday vaccine hours. Mass-inoculation sites set up to administer thousands of shots daily are shutting down across the country.

title: Jobs Are Hard to Fill, and Ideology Makes It Hard to Understand Why
summary: There are millions of U.S. vacancies as the pandemic eases, but the reasons are more complicated than what those with a partisan agenda claim. Telling one story about why employers are struggling to hire workers doesn't come close to explaining what is going on with the job market.

title: Democratic-Leaning Suburbs Pose Redistricting Challenge for GOP
summary: Resume Subscription. GWINNETT COUNTY, Ga.-When Republicans were carving up the state into congressional districts a decade ago, Lynn Westmoreland saw the warning signs for his party in the Atlanta suburbs.

title: England Opens a Lane to the Euro 2020 Final
summary: The Three Lions tower over their half of the draw after a cathartic win over Germany. Italy, Belgium and Spain lurk on the other side of the bracket.. LONDON-The brutal efficiency, the defensive rigor, the cold-eyed finishes. England had seen them all over decades of heartbreaking clashes with Germany. And it knew that Tuesday's Euro 2020 knockout game against its historically punishing opponent would only bring more.

title: Boom Says Its Supersonic Jet Will Be Green Too. Not Everybody's Convinced.
summary: The startup plans to use scarce zero-carbon fuel for its jet, which will use more fuel per passenger than regular planes. Boom Technology Inc. is trying to revive supersonic travel, but the most ambitious part of its plan might be to run its aircraft on 100% sustainable fuels.

title: Short-Staffed Restaurants Prop Up Table Service With Technology
summary: Labor shortage encourages full-service chains to deploy serverless ordering and payment strategies that were pioneered in fast food. Casual-dining chains are leaning on technology to make the sit-down restaurant experience more automated for guests and more streamlined for busy employees-and in some cases to compensate for a shortage of servers.

title: High-Frequency Trader Hudson River to Execute Retail Stock Trades
summary: Firm plans to enter the retail wholesaler business by early 2022, taking on Citadel Securities and Virtu Financial. Hudson River Trading LLC, one of the biggest high-frequency trading firms, is planning to enter the business of executing stock trades for individual investors.

title: California Drought Leads to Cutbacks in Marin County but Not in San Diego
summary: Resume Subscription. SAN DIEGO-At the southern end of California, residents have been assured their water supplies are secure and plentiful despite the state's severe drought.

title: Traveling for July Fourth? Expect Crowds. Everywhere.
summary: Summer travel approaches prepandemic levels, as Americans hit the road or take to the skies. Travel for the July Fourth holiday weekend is expected to reach levels not seen since before the Covid-19 pandemic, as millions of Americans make bucket-list trips or reunite with family and friends after a year-plus of lockdowns and distancing.

title: Delta Variant's Spread Outpaces Australia's Covid-19 Contact Tracers
summary: Resume Subscription. SYDNEY-The exchange, captured by CCTV camera, lasted only seconds.

title: North Korea's Kim Warns of 'Great Crisis' Over Covid-19 Response
summary: Leader doesn't specify what has gone wrong, but blames top officials for missteps. SEOUL-Kim Jong Un said North Korea's Covid-19 situation has become grave and admonished senior officials for lapses in the fight against the disease.

title: China's Economy Flashes Hints of Weakness
summary: Expansion in the factory sector slowed in June, while the services sector softened as Covid-19 outbreaks dampened consumer sentiment. BEIJING-Expansion in China's factory sector slowed in June, as export demand weakened while supply bottlenecks held back production, official data showed Wednesday.

title: Private Equity Gears Up for the Siege of Japan Inc.
summary: Private-equity firms are building up a large war chest to target Japanese companies. Toshiba could be on the menu soon.. Private-equity funds have a growing interest in Japan-and are making surprisingly good money there. The scandal at venerable Japanese electronics maker Toshiba could shape up as a test case for just how big the industry can grow in the world's third-largest economy.

title: Detroit's Second-Quarter Sales Were Terrible, but Does It Matter?
summary: GM and Ford will post their worst market share numbers in decades as a result of the semiconductor shortage, according to a preliminary tally. The headlines could get ugly in the coming days for Detroit car makers, Ford Motor in particular. Quarterly sales aren't the warning flag they used to be, but investors might benefit from a more cautious stance anyway.

title: Heat Wave Caused at Least 76 Deaths in Pacific Northwest
summary: Many of the dead in Multnomah County, Ore., were alone and lacked air conditioning or fans. At least 76 people died in Oregon and Washington from excessive heat during a stifling heat wave that hit the Pacific Northwest in the past several days, according to local authorities.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Fox News Settles NYC Probe of Network's Work Culture for $1 Million
summary: Agreement requires cable channel to waive forced employees' arbitration for four years, among other provisions, following investigation of sexual-harassment claims made under Roger Ailes. Fox News agreed to pay the New York City Commission on Human Rights a $1 million settlement to resolve an investigation of sexual harassment claims that occurred during the late Roger Ailes's tenure as chairman and chief executive of the cable network.

title: Heat Wave Eases for Seattle, Tightens Grip Inland
summary: Record-breaking temperatures threaten fruit and salmon in central Washington. YAKIMA, Wash.-A record-breaking heat wave eased for coastal cities in the Pacific Northwest but tightened its grip inland, threatening people, crops and wildlife.

title: Elections Board to Re-Tally Votes in NYC Mayoral Race
summary: The Board of Elections spokeswoman says there were 135,000 dummy ballots inadvertently included in Tuesday's count. The New York City Board of Elections will redo its tally of votes in the Democratic mayoral race after inadvertently including tens of thousands of test-run ballots in its count, a board spokeswoman said Tuesday night.

title: House Backs Bill Removing Confederate Statues From Capitol
summary: Measure targets statues and busts of figures who supported slavery or white supremacy. WASHINGTON-The House voted 285-120 Tuesday to remove statues of Confederates and other historical figures who advocated for slavery or white supremacy from public display in the U.S. Capitol.

title: Tech Spending Expected to Rise as Pandemic Restrictions Ease, Economy Improves
summary: Forrester Research raises its 2021 forecast for IT spending growth from 6% to 7.4%. Liberty Mutual Group Chief Information Officer James McGlennon plans to spend more this year on the software and tools behind digital experiences customers became accustomed to during the pandemic.

title: Supreme Court Declines to Lift National Eviction Moratorium
summary: High court rejects landlords' emergency request to suspend enforcement of moratorium imposed by CDC. WASHINGTON-A divided Supreme Court on Tuesday declined to lift a national moratorium on the eviction of tenants who have fallen behind on their rent during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Biden Weighs New Executive Order Restraining Big Business
summary: The action under consideration would go beyond traditional antitrust enforcement. The Biden administration is developing an executive order directing agencies to strengthen oversight of industries that they perceive to be dominated by a small number of companies, a wide-ranging attempt to rein in big business power across the economy, according to people familiar with the plans.
